alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 02 at 4:53PM MST until December 04 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, especially across southwestern portions of the Park. Total snow accumulations will vary greatly across the Park, but totals of 12 to 18 inches are expected across southern and eastern portions. Up to 24 inches possible across far southwestern areas. Expect a southwest wind gusting up to 40 mph. * WHERE...Yellowstone National Park. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...The combination of snow and wind will create hazardous backcountry travel. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lesser snow totals are expected over northern Yellowstone. Possible totals range from an inch or two around Mammoth to closer to 4 to 8 inches near Canyon, Lake, and Madison Junction. 8 to 12 inches expected around the Old Faithful and Grant Village areas. There will be a relative lull in the snowfall late tonight and Sunday morning. For forecast snowfall images, go to weather.gov/riverton/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
